verses.roman:
candanera aṅgada-bālā, candana-bhūṣaṇa
nṛtya-kāle pari' karena kṛṣṇa-saṅkīrtana

synonyms: candanera—of sandalwood; aṅgada—and armlets; bālā—bangles; candana—of sandalwood pulp; bhūṣaṇa—decorations; nṛtya-kāle—at the time of dancing; pari'-putting on; karena—does; kṛṣṇa-saṅkīrtana—congregational chanting of the name of Kṛṣṇa.
translation: He is decorated with sandalwood bangles and armlets and anointed with the pulp of sandalwood. He especially wears these decorations to dance in śrī-kṛṣṇa-saṅkīrtana.
